synopsis.text: Ranpo Kitan: Game of Laplace unfolds a chilling tale of mystery and horror, drawing inspiration from the works of the renowned author, Ranpo Edogawa. The story takes a grim turn when a series of murders occur at a seemingly ordinary middle school, catching the attention of the brilliant high school detective, Kogorou Akechi. Amidst the chaos, middle school student Yoshio Kobayashi awakens in his classroom to find himself in an unimaginable situation: his teacher's lifeless body lies before him, and he is holding the murder weapon. Despite the initial shock, Yoshio's curiosity and detachment lead him to feel a secret thrill at being framed. With his reluctant friend, Souji Hashiba, by his side, Yoshio is determined to prove his innocence. As Akechi arrives at the crime scene to investigate, an intense connection forms between the detective and the accused student. Driven by mutual interest, Yoshio expresses his desire to assist Akechi in his crime-solving endeavors, while Akechi is eager to test the young boy's mettle. Prepare for a dark and twisted journey filled with bizarre and brutal crimes in this surreal anime that pays homage to the influence of Ranpo Edogawa on Japanese fiction.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
